description: This is a research- and writing-intensive module designed to guide students toward developing research proposals involving interdisciplinary legal research. It covers interdisciplinary approaches to legal research and research methodologies including qualitative, survey, and archive-based research. Students will work in a seminar-style environment and learn from one another through discussions inside and outside the classroom. This module is suitable for – but not limited to – students in their penultimate year who plan to undertake interdisciplinary research that involves legal norms, rules, or rights and their relationship to social relations or change.
title: Interdisciplinary Legal Research Methods
